techmeme.title: Gensol's financial woes have cast doubt on the future of BluSmart, an Indian EV ride-hailing startup founded by Gensol's promoters, Anmol Jaggi and Puneet Jaggi (Debarghya Sil/Inc42 Media)
FTX tells a US bankruptcy judge it will make the first payment to its main creditors on May 30 using the $11.4B cash hoard it has collected since shutting down (Steven Church/Bloomberg)
Adalytics: DoubleVerify, IAS, and Human Security, paid by advertisers to detect bots, regularly miss such traffic; DoubleVerify missed 21% of bot visits (Patience Haggin/Wall Street Journal)
In the latest Windows 11 preview build, Microsoft removed the "bypassnro" command, which let users skip signing into a Microsoft Account when installing Windows (Zac Bowden/Windows Central)
A US judge rejects Musk's bid to dismiss a lawsuit claiming he defrauded ex-Twitter shareholders by delaying the disclosure of his initial Twitter investment (Jonathan Stempel/Reuters)
